page.title: 01The Fulwood Area.
page.content: In the Middle Ages, Fulwood was part of a Royal Forest. By the early 1800's it was still largely forest and waste land, then in 1850 farmland was bought and its development began. In 1895 Fulwood became an urban district and since then it has developed as a residential area. Pre-war development tended to follow the line of the A6. After the war large estates grew first to the west of the A6 and since 1980 on its eastern side.These developments are bounded by the M6 & M55 motorways. The area to the north and east of the motorways is still largely farmland with small residential developments. Fulwood exists mainly as a residential and farming area with little industry. It has 3 high schools, 2 hospitals,a barracks, hotels, restaurants, shops and a leisure centre which serve a much wider area.
